intro: Hypoxis fischeri var. colliculata, commonly known as the mountain hypoxis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
